hh3cStormConstrain.name: hh3cStormConstrain
hh3cStormConstrain.contactinfo: Platform Team Hangzhou H3C Tech. Co., Ltd. Hai-Dian District Beijing P.R. China http://www.h3c.com Zip:100085
hh3cStormConstrain.description: The Storm-Constrain function is used to avoid the packet-storm on a port. Three types of flux can be set observed respectively: broadcast, multicast and unicast. If an observed flux exceeds its upper limit, this kind of flux will be recognized as over-upper-flux. This kind of flux will be considered as normal-flux until it falls below its lower limit. If any type of observed flux is over-upper-flux, the port will change its status to controlled-status, that is to stop packet forwarding to avoid storm. Only when all the observed fluxes are not over-upper-flux, will the port return to normal(forwarding) status.

Hh3cStormConstrainUnit.name: Hh3cStormConstrainUnit
Hh3cStormConstrainUnit.description: The unit of the flux. none: not define. packetsPerSecond: packets per second. ratio: unit is 1%. For example, if the value is 40, it means 40%. bytesPerSecond: bytes per second. kbitsPerSecond: kilobits per second.

hh3cStormTrapType.name: hh3cStormTrapType
hh3cStormTrapType.description: This value is used to identify the type of trap. broadcast: trap message is generated for broadcast flux exceeds upper limit or falls under lower limit on a port. multicast: trap message is generated for multicast flux exceeds upper limit or falls under lower limit on a port. unicast : trap message is generated for unicast flux exceeds upper limit or falls under lower limit on a port.

hh3cStormTrapThreshold.name: hh3cStormTrapThreshold
hh3cStormTrapThreshold.description: This value is used to figure the threshold of flux in trap message. For example, when the trap is generated for broadcast flux exceeds upper limit on a port, this value is equal to upper limit value configured. And when the trap is generated for broadcast flux fell under lower limit, this value is equal to lower limit value configured.

hh3cStormCtrlTable.name: hh3cStormCtrlTable
hh3cStormCtrlTable.description: A table containing configurations of storm-constrain.

hh3cStormCtrlPortStatus.name: hh3cStormCtrlPortStatus
hh3cStormCtrlPortStatus.description: Status of the port: controlled: indicate that the port is in controlled status. Port which is in this status will not forward some type of packet. normal : indicate that the port is in normal status.

hh3cStormCtrlBroadcastUnit.name: hh3cStormCtrlBroadcastUnit
hh3cStormCtrlBroadcastUnit.description: The unit of the broadcast flux. This value must be set together with hh3cStormCtrlBroadcastUpper and hh3cStormCtrlBroadcastLower.

hh3cStormCtrlBroadcastUpper.name: hh3cStormCtrlBroadcastUpper
hh3cStormCtrlBroadcastUpper.description: The upper-limit of incoming broadcast taffic at a port within 1 second interval. Its unit depends on hh3cStormCtrlBroadcastUnit value.

hh3cStormCtrlBroadcastLower.name: hh3cStormCtrlBroadcastLower
hh3cStormCtrlBroadcastLower.description: The lower-limit of incoming broadcast taffic at a port within 1 second interval. This value must be lower than hh3cStormCtrlBroadcastUpper value. Its unit depends on hh3cStormCtrlBroadcastUnit value.

hh3cStormCtrlMulticastUnit.name: hh3cStormCtrlMulticastUnit
hh3cStormCtrlMulticastUnit.description: The unit of the multicast flux. This value must be set together with hh3cStormCtrlMulticastUpper and hh3cStormCtrlMulticastLower.

hh3cStormCtrlMulticastUpper.name: hh3cStormCtrlMulticastUpper
hh3cStormCtrlMulticastUpper.description: The upper-limit of incoming multicast taffic at a port within 1 second interval. Its unit depends on hh3cStormCtrlMulticastUnit value.

hh3cStormCtrlMulticastLower.name: hh3cStormCtrlMulticastLower
hh3cStormCtrlMulticastLower.description: The lower-limit of incoming multicast taffic at a port within 1 second interval. This value must be lower than hh3cStormCtrlMulticastUpper value. Its unit depends on hh3cStormCtrlMulticastUnit value.

hh3cStormCtrlUnicastUnit.name: hh3cStormCtrlUnicastUnit
hh3cStormCtrlUnicastUnit.description: The unit of the unicast flux. This value must be set together with hh3cStormCtrlUnicastUpper and hh3cStormCtrlUnicastLower.

hh3cStormCtrlUnicastUpper.name: hh3cStormCtrlUnicastUpper
hh3cStormCtrlUnicastUpper.description: The upper-limit of incoming unicast taffic at a port within 1 second interval. Its unit depends on hh3cStormCtrlUnicastUnit value.

hh3cStormCtrlUnicastLower.name: hh3cStormCtrlUnicastLower
hh3cStormCtrlUnicastLower.description: The lower-limit of incoming unicast taffic at a port within 1 second interval. This value must be lower than hh3cStormCtrlUnicastUpper value. Its unit depends on hh3cStormCtrlUnicastUnit value.

hh3cStormCtrlRowStatus.name: hh3cStormCtrlRowStatus
hh3cStormCtrlRowStatus.description: This object is responsible for managing the creation, deletion and modification of rows, which supports active status and CreatAndGo, destroy operation.

hh3cStormCtrlPortMode.name: hh3cStormCtrlPortMode
hh3cStormCtrlPortMode.description: The storm control mode of the port.

hh3cStormRising.name: hh3cStormRising
hh3cStormRising.description: This trap message is generated when any type of the flux exceeds its upper limit on a port.

hh3cStormFalling.name: hh3cStormFalling
hh3cStormFalling.description: This trap message is generated when a flux which used to overflow its upper limit, falls below its lower limit on a port.
